snippet: The number of unfilled jobs in the American economy has risen to the highest level since 2008. At the same time, the ratio of unemployed workers to openings has fallen to about half the peak level, although it remains significantly higher than it was...
lead_paragraph: The number of unfilled jobs in the American economy has risen to the highest level since 2008. At the same time, the ratio of unemployed workers to openings has fallen to about half the peak level, although it remains significantly higher than it was before the recession began at the end of 2007. Turnover in jobs remains below historical levels, reflecting a reluctance of employees to risk what they have. The proportion of dismissals among those leaving their jobs has fallen, but remains above prerecession levels.

headline.seo: Off the Charts: More Openings, Fewer Firings
headline.main: Off the Charts: More Openings, Fewer Firings
